thread.title: A change in position for Browns' Justin Gilbert?
thread.title_full: A change in position for Browns' Justin Gilbert?

author: newsnet5.com staff
title: A change in position for Browns' Justin Gilbert?
text:
Previous Next 
CLEVELAND - Cleveland Browns former first-round pick Justin Gilbert has yet to show his worth on the defensive side of the ball. 
So now the Browns are looking to use him elsewhere. 
Gilbert is set to become the team's kick returner. 
In college, Gilbert set a record at Oklahoma State with six kickoff returns for touchdowns. 
He says he's willing to take on the new role, if that's where the team wants him. 
“If it happens, I wouldn’t back away from it," Gilbert said Friday. "I would be happy to do it. Wherever I can help out the team that will give a chance to have a ball in my hands, which I like to do, I would love it.” 
Head coach Mike Pettine said he hopes his success as a kick returner will give him some more confidence. 
"We’re happy for him that he’s put the work in and he’s practiced well," said Pettine. "He did get results on the field, and we’re hoping that’ll energize him when the time comes for him to play corner for us that he’ll be just as effective.” Copyright 2015 Scripps Media, Inc.
